prompt: What option(s) of the ls command display recursive contents?
explain: The ls command lists directory contents. The lowercase -r --reverse option reverses the display order. The uppercase -R --recursive option displays subdirectories recursively. While most commands support a recursive option -R, the cp (file copy) command aliases both for convenience.

prompt: Which statement(s) are true regarding the kernel ring buffer?
accept: It is constrained by limited memory space
The oldest entries are discarded first
reject: It transports data packets across Local Area Networks
The grep command is used to access buffer entries
Entries persist after rebooting the system
Only the ring command may access buffer entries
explain: The Linux kernel initializes the kernel ring buffer as an early logging mechanism. Kernel modules, compiled or inserted, may verbosely add to the buffer. It is a limited size buffer because the early boot stage doesn't have access to disk storage yet. The memory allocated for the kernel ring buffer cannot be simultaneously used by programs.

prompt: Which application(s) are frequently executed by web servers?
explain: Websites with server side components frequently use ImageMagick to resize and crop pictures. For example, a forum may create avatars or thumbnails in smaller resolutions to reduce storage and transfer sizes. GIMP and Blender are multimedia applications for raster image editing and video rendering. The /etc/passwd file contains a list of user accounts. Ubuntu is a distribution based on Debian.

links.title: ImageMagick - Create, Edit, Compose, or Convert Digital Images

prompt: Which tar option(s) enable the bzip2 compression algorithm?
explain: The tar "tape archive" program supports mutliple compression algorithms including gzip, bzip2, and xz. Specifying the -j --bzip2 option outputs a bzip2 compressed archive during -c --create mode or inputs a bzip2 compressed archive during -x --extract mode. Related options include -z --gzip for gzip compression; -J -xz for xz compression; -v --verbose for increased verbosity; and -f name --file name to specify the archive file in context.
terminal: $PS1 tar -c -v -f archive.bz2 -j homework.txt ←

prompt: Which field corresponds to the UID of the /etc/passwd file?
explain: The /etc/passwd file specifies attributes for each user account in the system. Each field is separated by a colon ":" character. The format follows the USERNAME:PASSWORD:UID:GID:GECOS:HOMEDIR:SHELL specification. Environment variables expose the current user's home directory path via the HOME variable.

prompt: Which program displays kernel build information?
explain: The uname program displays version, release, and build information about the running kernel. Latest information about the Linux kernel project is available at kernel.org

prompt: What is the exit status given the command: cat /etc/skel/?
explain: Exit statuses, or error codes, are zero/non-zero values to determine if the previous operation was successful. A zero value indicates the operation was successful, whereas a non-zero value is an unsuccessful operation. Programs and scripts may choose what the status is for different scenarios.

links.title: Advanced Bash-Scripting Guide: Chapter 6. Exit and Exit Status

prompt: Which database management system could be found in a Linux system?
explain: MySQL was released in 1995 as a relational database system. MariaDB forked from MySQL in 2010 due to licensing issues. PostgreSQL is another open-source database system with advanced workloads and cross-platform support.
terminal: ii mariadb-client-10.3 1:10.3.18-0+deb1 amd64 MariaDB database client

prompt: Which command has a --lock option?
explain: The passwd command has special permissions to update the /etc/shadow "shadow" file. Typical usage is to replace the one-way hashed passwords, but the --lock option prevents an account from further loggin.
terminal: $PS1 sudo -u root cat /etc/shadow | grep student
-a, --all          report password status on all accounts
-d, --delete       delete the password for the named account
-e, --expire       force expire the password for the named account
-h, --help         display this help message and exit
-l, --lock lock the password of the named account
-S, --status       report password status on the named account
-u, --unlock       unlock the password of the named account

prompt: Programs send error messages to which channel?
explain: All processes have three channels: standard input, standard output, and standard error. A file descriptor represents each of the buffers: 0, 1, 2 respectively. IO redirection syntax is written as > to redirect standard output while overwriting the destination; >> to redirect standard output while appending to the destination; 2> to redirec tthe standard error channel. Channels can be combined and piped as well. The 2>&1 syntax smashes standard error (2) into standard output (1).

links.title: Linux Crash Course - Data Streams (stdin, stdout & stderr)

prompt: The shebang is represented by which two letter sequence?
explain: The two letter #! shebang must be on the first line of a shell script to identify which interpreter will be executed. Common interpreters include /usr/bin/bash, /bin/sh, /usr/bin/perl, and /usr/bin/python3. Executable shell scripts should have the +x permission.
terminal: the date is Thu Jun 8 23:16:32 UTC 2021

prompt: Which command(s) display IP routing information?
explain: Computers are assigned an IP address within a network. Gateway servers provide uplink access to distant networks. IP routing information helps the system know which gateway should be used through subnet masking. The ip route show and route commands display routing information.

explain:
The usage requires an optional path before any expressions.
find [path...] [expression]
Helpful expressions are:
  • -type f for files
  • -type d for directories
  • -name pattern to filter names
  • -iname pattern to filter names while ignoring cases
  • -exec command to execute an external command

prompt: Where are critical operating system launched from on a Raspberry Pi device?
explain: Raspberry Pi devices are low-cost, card sized computers for small projects and educational environments. They do not contain hard disk or solid state drives. While most hardware versions include a microSD card slot, early versions included a full sized SD card slot. Network booting is possible but depends on firmware upgrades not included by manufacturers.

prompt: Which program(s) are command line web clients?
explain: Web clients and servers typically communicate through the HTTP protocol encapsulated with SSL encryption. Web browsers are great for displaying visual renderings of web pages but are not necessary to download files or upload payloads. wget and curl are common command line programs used in conjunction with web server requests.
terminal: HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK

prompt:
Which keyword is missing from the following script?
for color in red green blue
  echo color is $color
done
explain: For loops consist of a variable color, collection red green blue, and an action echo color is $color. The action block is defined between do and done to allow for multiple actions. Simple globbing happens before execution.

links.title: Bash Guide for Beginners - 9.1. The for loop

terminal: $PS1 for f in *.txt ; do echo file is $f ; done
$PS1 for color in red green blue ; do echo color is $color ; done

prompt: Memory information is parsed by which command?
explain: Physical and virtual memory information is exposed by the Linux kernel via the /proc/meminfo file. The -m option transforms values into megabytes. Some versions support an -h option for human readable format.
terminal: total    used    free  shared  buff/cache  available
total    used    free  shared  buff/cache  available
total    used    free  shared  buff/cache  available

prompt: Which command(s) query Domain Name System (DNS) records?
explain: Depending on the level of detail, dig and host can perform DNS queries. Dig offers more verbosity and operation timing, whereas host yields direct answers. Nameserver (NS), Mail Exchange (MX), IPv4 Address (A), IPv6 Address (AAAA), Canonical name (CNAME), Text (TXT), and Service (SRV) records are critical for network infrastructures.
terminal: ;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

prompt: Applying mode g+x to an existing file with octal 644 yields which permissions?
explain:
Read, write, and execute permissions can be applied to the owning user (u), group (g), or other (o). Each group can be expressed as an octal 0-7 or mode rwx. Consider each binary bit as a light switch that can be off (0) or on (1):
rwx
..
000 = no permission
001 = executable (1)
010 = writable (2)
100 = readable (4)
..
011 = writable + executable (3)
101 = readable + executable (5)
110 = readable + writable (6)
111 = readable + writable + executable (7)

prompt: Why are web browsing cookies considered to be harmful?
accept: stored information may be used to track browsing habits
reject: malicious code can be injected across websites
cookies require lots of hard disk drive space
advertisements can be customized by users
private web browsers leak sensitive information from regular cookies
explain:
Web browsers request content from web servers using a request-response protocol. Responses may provide a cache expiration date to reduce the number of requests. The protocol does not correlate multiple requests since the browser may not need to request cached content. Cookies are small pieces of information stored as pairs of keys and values. For example, Name=Smith or Course=Linux. E-commerce websites use session tracking cookies to temporarily persist information between requests. Websites need only set the session ID to look up accounting information in the backend. Some third-party advertisers use tracking cookies for concerning activities.

prompt: Which command would display the contents of a compressed zip archive named archive.zip?
explain: Not to be confused with tar "tape archive", zip and unzip are related to the zip format. Unzip has an -l option to verbosely list archive contents without performing the extraction.
terminal: Copyright (c) 1990-2008 Info-ZIP - Type 'zip -L' for software license.
zip [-options] [-b path] [-t mmddyyyy] [-n suffixes] [zipfile list] [-xi list]
UnZip 6.00 of 20 April 2009, by Debian. Original by Info-ZIP.

prompt: Which of the following programs are common command-line text editors?
explain: Many graphical text editors exist but command line text editors have advantages including lower protocol overhead and fewer dependencies. Nano is the continued efforts of pico from the pine email client project. Vi and vim are traditional text editors found in practically every Linux distribution.
terminal: echo my favorite color is Linux

^X Exit ^R Read File ^\ Replace ^U Paste
